TechInfo.Civilopedia: Scientists researched and developed new applications for nanotechnology. Some of these included a device that used nanites, self-reliant nano-scale "robots" manufactured for a specific purpose, to seek out and defuse every nuclear weapon in the world. Cities desperate for a way to meet the rising water demands of its citizens built Aqua-Filters, which deployed nanite "scrubbers" to extract pure water from abundant sources such as agricultural runoff and sewage.
TechInfo.Quote: "I wish I had never used the term 'grey goo'." ~ Eric Drexler

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Breakthroughs in nanotechnology give rise to the advance of Nano-Assembly. In a Nanite Factory, microscopic machines can assemble objects at the molecular level, increasing the productive power of Cities and allowing the construction of Sea Engineers which utilize Nano-Assembly to create Underwater Cities
TechInfo.Quote: "Solar cells and most modern displays are examples of organic hybrids. But as we move to a renaissance in medicine with nanotech, matter becomes code." ~ Steve Jurvetson

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Cybernetics is the discovery of robotic enhancements and replacements for the human body. This has far-reaching uses in the realm of combat. The War Walker unit takes advantage of cybernetic technology, terrorizing all that cross its path.
TechInfo.Quote: "Cybernetics: The scientific study of control and communication in the animal and the machine." ~ Norbert Wiener.

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Plasma weapons take conventional warfare to a new level. Capable of delivering extreme amounts of damage, The Plasma Destroyer dominates the battlefield with its terror-inspiring weapons.
Ultra-Pressure Machines are capable of operating under extremely harsh conditions. The Crawler is such a machine, capable of traveling to the absolute depths of the ocean and transporting land units.
TechInfo.Quote: "Everything is rice. And you cook it in a pressure cooker. Because you're fancy, and I hate finding quotes." ~ General Pear

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Fluid Breathing is an Advance that enables humans to explore the farthest depths of the ocean, unencumbered by the need for pressurized cabins in underwater craft. By filling the lungs with a special fluid, the human body is no longer limited by its ability to withstand the pressure of the deep.
TechInfo.Quote: "Do they look like fish to you?" ~ Aquaman

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Whereas Newtonian Physics, Quantum Physics and Chaos Theory were, in some ways, each inadequate to explain all aspects of the known universe, Unified Physics explains the nature of everything. The application of this revolutionary new science makes unimaginable things possible, such as the construction of a National Shield.
TechInfo.Quote: "We need a theory of everything. Perhaps, the ultimate triumph of science." ~ Stephen Hawking

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Chaos Theory is a radical new approach to mathematics and the way the universe works. Scientists who master Chaos Theory and its applications can make that which seems impossible possible. The Ability to defy gravity.
TechInfo.Quote: "Chaos: When the present determines the future, but the approximate present does not approximately determine the future." ~ Edward Lorenz

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Life Extension takes people another step towards immortality. With the Body Exchange building people have the opportunity to transfer their consciousness to a new, healthier body, extending their years on the planet considerably.
TechInfo.Quote: "Surely God would not have created such a being as man, with an ability to grasp the infinite, to exist only for a day! No, no, man was made for immortality." ~ Abraham Lincoln

TechInfo.Civilopedia: [TAB]Genetic Tailoring takes Cloning one step further, enabling the total customization of human life. Children are no longer born as much as they are "grown," with any combination of superior mental and physical attributes.
TechInfo.Quote: "I not only think that we will tamper with Mother Nature, I think Mother wants us to." - Willard Gaylin

TechInfo.Civilopedia: [TAB]While the first animals were successfully cloned in the late twentieth century, human cloning was not perfected until decades later. And then only if one uses the term "perfected" in the loosest sense. After much research it became possible to create a physical clone of a human being, identical to the original model down to the smallest detail; however, the clones remain frustratingly incapable of rational thought. All attempts to educate these creatures have failed miserably, and the "smartest" clone remains little more than a drooling moron whose needs must be constantly attended to. So while clones remain excellent organ and limb donors, up until recently little else could be done with them. [PARAGRAPH:2]Recent scientific advances have allowed clones to be equipped with sophisticated computer systems capable of controlling the clones' movement. While the computers are not yet sophisticated enough to allow for the creation of "clone warriors," the zombie-like beings are capable of performing simple, repetitive actions like building roads, tilling farmland, and so forth, doing so more efficiently than purely human workers.
TechInfo.Strategy: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cloning[COLOR_REVERT] permits construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clone Factories[COLOR_REVERT] and then [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clones[COLOR_REVERT].
TechInfo.Quote: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." - Pink Floyd, 'The Wall'

TechInfo.Civilopedia: [TAB]Hydroponics is the science of growing vegetables in nutrient solutions rather than in soil. The earliest references to hydroponics date back to the seventeenth century, and while notable advances in research were seen over the following centuries, the first practical applications of hydroponics did not appear until the early twentieth century, and mass adoption didn't occur until the middle of the twenty-first century. There are two primary benefits to growing plants in nutrient solutions rather than in soil: the nutrient solution can be sterilized (unlike soil), greatly reducing the occurrence of disease and pests in the plants, and a much greater number of crops can be grown in a small area. [PARAGRAPH:2]The primary downside to this method of cultivation is that it requires a fair degree of technical know-how to install and maintain the complicated machines necessary to keep the "scum-ponds" healthy and productive. However, once education levels improved in rural populations across the world, this was no longer an impediment, and the practice has since spread rapidly, greatly increasing the world's food supply.
TechInfo.Quote: "All right. Maybe it DOES taste like wet cardboard - but it sure beats starving." [PARAGRAPH:1] - Dexter Ambrose, Agricultural Engineer
"The advance of genetic engineering makes it quite conceivable that we will begin to design our own evolutionary progress." - Isaac Asimov

TechInfo.Civilopedia: [TAB]Aquaculture is the practice of cultivating the produce of water for consumption. Humans have been harvesting the bounty of the seas for all of history; however, as human population has grown exponentially, by the late twentieth century, much greater emphasis has been placed on so-called "sustainable" aquaculture. Indeed the Treaty of Iceland, signed in 2033, mandated that, "No fish or mammal may be harvested from the ocean unless an equal or greater number of the same species are released into the wild at the same time." Unfortunately, with the collapse of the One World Government this treaty lost much of its efficacy, and the world's once-boundless supply of food is again under grave and imminent peril. [PARAGRAPH:2]Facing this dwindling supply of animal protein, aquaculture has focused upon the cultivation of oceanic vegetation like kelp and seaweed. Although plentiful, the resulting food has met with mixed reviews: while certain island and coastal cultures claim that these foods are delicacies, the rest of humanity appears to be in general agreement that they taste "like salty rubber, but not as good."
TechInfo.Strategy: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aquaculture[COLOR_REVERT] increases the food production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing Boats[COLOR_REVERT] by +2.
TechInfo.Quote: "Kelp - it's what's for breakfast!"[PARAGRAPH:1] - Advertisement for 'Kelp Krunchies' cereal

TechInfo.Civilopedia: Renewable energy is energy that comes from natural resources such as sunlight, wind, rain, tides, waves and geothermal heat.
TechInfo.Quote: The two most abundant forms of power on earth are solar and wind, and they're getting cheaper and cheaper… - Ed Begley, Jr.
"One kills a man, one is an assassin; one kills millions, one is a conqueror; one kills everybody, one is a god." - Jean Roustand

TechInfo.Civilopedia:
Researching Modern Espionage will enable the following new spy missions:
[ICON_BULLET]Create a Diplomatic Incident [ICON_BULLET]Incite Anarchy [ICON_BULLET]Setup Fifth Column [ICON_BULLET]Bribe Leaders [ICON_BULLET]Exert Influence [ICON_BULLET]Plant Nuclear Device [ICON_BULLET]Disable Power Grid [ICON_BULLET]Stage Anti-War Rally [ICON_BULLET]Sabotage Research
